definition[0]: to receive money, property etc from someone after they have died
example[1]: He inherited a fortune from his grandmother.
definition[1]: if you inherit a situation, especially one in which problems have been caused by other people, you have to deal with it
example[2]: The present government inherited a closed, state-dominated economy.
definition[2]: to have the same character or appearance as your parents
example[3]: I inherited my mother’s curly hair.
example[4]: Mr. Grass inherited his work ethic from his father.
definition[3]: to get something that someone else does not want anymore
example[5]: We inherited the furniture from the previous tenants.
definition[4]: to receive money or property from someone after they have died
example[6]: She will inherit her father’s entire fortune when he dies.
example[7]: We built the house on land inherited from our uncle.
definition[5]: to start being in charge of something that was previously controlled by another person
example[8]: The incoming president inherited a healthy economy.
example[9]: Problems he inherited from his predecessor led to the bank’s later troubles.
